p: Among DENV 4, there are four genotypes (I, II, III and Sylvatic). The dengue cases from DENV 4 genotype I (DENV 4-I) have increased in recent years. In 2013, a large DENV outbreak occurred in central Vietnam with a total of 204,661 clinical cases reported, of which 48.9% were DENV 4-I cases [ 10]. The same year, DENV 1-I, DENV 2-I and DENV 4-I caused a large outbreak with 20,255 cases including 84 deaths in Myanmar [ 11]. In Sri Lanka, the dominant virus in the 2012 epidemic was DENV 1, but DENV 4-I infections were also commonly observed [ 12]. While all four serotypes have been detected, a 2015 study showed that dengue in China remains primarily an imported disease with DENV 1 most frequently found in samples [ 13]. However, since 2013 several strains of DENV 4-I have been detected in Yunnan Province, China. Among the recorded DENV 4-I strains, both imported and autochthonous cases were found.
